Article Title: 'Congress has sworn to insult her': BJP on AI video of PM Modi's mother; blames Rahul Gandhi's 'arrogance'
Article Text:
PM Modi and his mother Heeraben Modi (File photo)

BJP X post

NEW DELHI: The BJP on Thursday slammed the Congress over an AI-generated video featuring Prime Minister Narendra Modi and his late mother Heeraben, accusing the party of taking a vow to “repeatedly insult” her. The clip was posted by the Bihar unit of the Congress.“The Congress has sworn to repeatedly insult the late mother of PM Shri Narendra Modi Ji. When they found nothing, they showed his mother in a fake video, making her say words that are a complete insult to her,” the Bihar BJP posted on X, alleging that such videos were being circulated at the behest of “arrogant” and “anarchic” Rahul Gandhi.The clip, shared on Wednesday, begins with an AI version of PM Modi going to sleep after declaring that the day’s “vote chori” (vote theft) is done. He then dreams of his mother, and the AI version of Heeraben appears.“First you forced me to stand in long queues during demonetisation and made a reel of washing my feet. Now you are doing politics in Bihar in my name. You are getting banners of my ‘insult’ printed. You are again doing drama in Bihar. How low will you stoop?” she asks, before “PM Modi” hurriedly wakes up.Gandhi has repeatedly accused the Election Commission of indulging in “vote chori” to benefit the BJP — a charge the poll body has firmly denied.This comes days after the prime minister was abused during a Congress-RJD rally in the poll-bound state, with his mother being mentioned. He hit back soon after, calling the remarks an insult not only to him but to “every mother, sister, and daughter of the country,” adding that the people of Bihar shared his anguish.Heeraben Modi passed away in December 2022 at the age of 99.
Article Summary: The clip was posted by the Bihar unit of the Congress. The clip begins with an AI version of PM Modi going to sleep. He then dreams of his mother, and a fake version of Heeraben Modi appears. This comes days after the prime minister was abused during a Congress-RJD rally.

Article Title: Abetment charge against Punjab AIG in realtor's death
Article Text: The case was lodged after police found a video and a handwritten note, both allegedly naming the accused. The AIG, currently posted with an SIT in the Northeast, earlier served as SP (traffic) and SP (cybercrime) in Mohali.In the video, purportedly recorded moments before his death, Rajveer accused the AIG of summoning him to his residence, abusing his family, filming them, and demanding further stakes in his business. "I'm fed up," he said.Inspector Satnam Singh said they are verifying the sequence of events. tnn
Article Summary: The case was lodged after police found a video and a handwritten note, both allegedly naming the accused. The AIG, currently posted with an SIT in the Northeast, earlier served as SP (traffic) and SP (cybercrime) in Mohali.

Article Title: SC collegium recommends appointment of chief justices for 3 high courts
Article Text: NEW DELHI: The Supreme Court's three-member collegium Thursday recommended appointment of chief justices to the high courts of Manipur, Meghalaya and Patna.The collegium of CJI B R Gavai and Justices Surya Kant and Vikram Nath recommended to the Union govt to appoint Karnataka HC Justice P B Bajanthri as CJ of Patna HC (at present acting CJ of Patna HC), Calcutta HC Justice Soumen Sen as CJ of Meghalaya HC, and Madras HC Justice M Sunder as CJ of Manipur HC.Bajanthri was appointed a judge of Karnataka high court on Jan 2, 2015, and transferred to Punjab and Haryana HC two months later. He was repatriated to his parent HC in Nov 2018 and was again transferred to Patna high court in Oct 2021. At present, he is the acting chief justice of Patna HC and is scheduled to retire on Oct 22 this year.Sen was appointed as a judge of Calcutta HC in Apr 2011. The collegium recommended his name for appointment as CJ of Manipur, which at present is headed by Justice K Somashekar who is scheduled to retire on Sept 14. Manipur HC at present has three judges, including the CJ, even though the HC has sanctioned strength of five judges, including the CJ. Sundar was appointed a judge of Madras HC in Oct 2016. On the President appointing him as CJ of Meghalaya HC, the HC would attain its full strength of four judges, including the CJ.
Article Summary: The Supreme Court's three-member collegium Thursday recommended appointment of chief justices to the high courts of Manipur, Meghalaya and Patna. The collegium of CJI B R Gavai and Justices Surya Kant and Vikram Nath recommended to the Union govt to appoint Karnataka HC Justice P B Bajanthri as CJ of Patna HC.

Article Title: Bihar assembly elections: Two more parties join Mahagathbandhan; seat-sharing deal to get complex?
Article Text:
PM Modi’s 'Kosi' Jibe at Opposition Ignites Bihar Election Heat During MP Flats Inauguration

NEW DELHI: The seat-sharing negotiations for upcoming assembly elections in Bihar have become more complex as two new parties - Jharkhand Mukti Morcha (JMM) and Pashupati Paras's LJP faction - joined the Mahagathbandhan alliance. The situation is getting trickier as major parties are firm on their seat demands.The 243 seats will now be divided among eight parties -- Rashtriya Janata Dal, Congress, CPI, CPM, VIP, LJP (Paras) and JMM.“Two more parties are expected to be part of the INDIA bloc soon and we all have to sacrifice our share of seats to accommodate the new partners.” State Congress president Rajesh Kumar told reporters after a discussion during a key meeting of INDIA bloc leaders at the official residence of RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav.Meanwhile, Congress insist that it cannot go below the 70 seats.VIP chief Mukesh Sahani, on the other hand, has demanded “60 seats plus the post of deputy CM” while the CPI-ML is pressing for at least 40 seats, pointing to its past performance.The RJD is also unwilling to contest on fewer than 150 seats.In 2020 assembly elections, Rashtriya Janata Dal had contested on 144 seats, of which it won 75.Congress won 19 out of 70 seats.CPI-ML contested 19 seats and won 12.CPM contested 4 seats and was successful in winning 2 seats.CPI contested on 6 seats and won 2 seats.RJD's Tejashwi Yadav has already declared himself as the CM face of the opposition INDIA bloc.Addressing the rally in Ara town, the last stopover of the 'Voter Adhikar Yatra', Tejashwi questioned the Nitish Kumar government in Bihar for "frequently copying his ideas" and described it as a "copycat government". Ridiculing the government for copying his ideas, he said that at present he was moving ahead while the govt was behind him."Tejashwi aage-aage, Sarkar pichhe-pichhe. Original CM chahiye ki duplicate?" (Tejashwi is moving ahead while the govt is following him from behind. Do you want a duplicate CM or the original CM?), Tejashwi asked the crowd.
Article Summary: Two new parties - Jharkhand Mukti Morcha (JMM) and Pashupati Paras's LJP faction - joined the Mahagathbandhan alliance. The 243 seats will now be divided among eight parties -- Rashtriya Janata Dal, Congress, CPI, CPM, VIP, LJP (Paras) and JMM.

Article Title: Navi Mumbai: Police official films reel in car with child at steering wheel; case registered
Article Text: NAVI MUMBAI: A police sub-inspector attached to Nerul police station posted on his WhatsApp update a video reel of driving a car with a child sitting on his lap and holding the steering wheel.The video clip that went viral on social media on Thursday shows that the cop is not even wearing a seat belt while driving and at times he is not even holding the steering wheel to support the child. He is seen changing gears while the child is holding the steering wheel.The PSI has been identified as Bipin Tuturwad. Brahmanand Naikwadi, senior inspector of Nerul, said, "The incident happened last month in Ulwe as the PSI resides there. Then an offence has been registered at local police station against him under Motor Vehicle Act."
Article Summary: The video clip that went viral on social media on Thursday shows that the cop is not even wearing a seat belt while driving. He is seen changing gears while the child is holding the steering wheel. The PSI has been identified as Bipin Tuturwad.
